page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER IN THROWLEY
page.content: A policeman looks after the villag of Throwley. He is a rural community policeman. PC Reed looks after eight villages in all. His main job is to protect property and life and prevent crime and damage and investigate incidents. PC Reed works from his own home and decides his own shift to suit his community work,but is "on call"all hours.He keeps a motorbike and is responsible for the state of it. It is useful to him because he can use it on country foot paths and farm tracks. PC Reed's particular work in Throwley is stopping dogs worrying sheep and poaching.He also attends fires,road traffic accidents and issues fire arm certificates. PC Reed keeps an Alsation of his own which is a retired police dog.
